full_text: In this demonstration, I am going to add a general liability policy to the minor fleet management group. The premium will be paid by the management group, but the tax will be paid by the headquarters. Here's the minor fleet management group account. Let's create the policy. I click the Actions menu button. And I select Add Policy. First, I type in the policy number. Next, I click in the product field. Next, I click in the product field. I select General Liability from the list. Next, I click in the payment plan field. And I select PP12. Let's go to step 2. I'll add the premium charge first. I click Add. The premium charge is $16,200. I type in the amount. Next, I click Add. Next, I click Add. To add the taxes charge. I click in the type field for the charge. And I select taxes from the list of charge types. The taxes charge is for $1,200. Next, I type in the amount. I type in the amount. To change the payer for the tax. I'll click the search icon. I type M-I-N for the account name. Now I click Search. Here is Minor Fleet Headquarters in the search results. I select it. I click Finish. Let's go to the charges screen for the account. We can see the default payer for each of the two charges. The taxes charge is being paid by Demo 0610, which is the headquarters account, whereas the premium charge is being paid by Demo 0020, which is the policyholder. The taxes charge is being paid by Demo 0610. The taxes charge is being paid by Demo 0610. The charges screen allows me to reassign the payer of a charge, or even an individual invoice item for a charge. Suppose I want to assign a different payer to this invoice item. I simply click the checkbox next to the invoice item. And I click the arrow icon on the Assign Payer button. I can choose between an account payer and a producer payer. I choose Assign to Account. This screen lets me select a new payer and invoice stream, if the payer has multiple invoice streams. I can also decide how to handle invoice items that have been fully or partially paid. No change is needed, so I'll click Cancel to return to the charges screen. The charges screen has a filter for restricting the charges shown to those owned or paid by the account. First, I select Only Own & Pay. Selecting Only Own & Pay shows just the premium charge, because it is paid by the policy owner. Next, I select Only Owned. Only Owned shows all charges that are owned by the account, regardless of the payer. In this case, we see both the premium and the taxes charges. Let's see what the Only Payer filter does. Selecting Only Payer filters out the taxes charge because the Miner Fleet Management group is not the payer of the invoice item for the taxes charge. This concludes our demo on designating an alternate payer. segments.text: In this demonstration, I am going to add a general liability policy to the minor fleet management group. The premium will be paid by the management group, but the tax will be paid by the headquarters. Here's the minor fleet management group account. Let's create the policy. I click the Actions menu button. And I select Add Policy. First, I type in the policy number.

Next, I click in the product field. Next, I click in the product field. I select General Liability from the list. Next, I click in the payment plan field. And I select PP12. Let's go to step 2. I'll add the premium charge first. I click Add. The premium charge is $16,200.

I type in the amount. Next, I click Add. Next, I click Add. To add the taxes charge. I click in the type field for the charge. And I select taxes from the list of charge types. The taxes charge is for $1,200.
Next, I type in the amount. I type in the amount. To change the payer for the tax. I'll click the search icon. I type M-I-N for the account name. Now I click Search.
Here is Minor Fleet Headquarters in the search results. I select it. I click Finish.

Let's go to the charges screen for the account. We can see the default payer for each of the two charges. The taxes charge is being paid by Demo 0610, which is the headquarters account, whereas the premium charge is being paid by Demo 0020, which is the policyholder.

The taxes charge is being paid by Demo 0610. The taxes charge is being paid by Demo 0610. The charges screen allows me to reassign the payer of a charge, or even an individual invoice item for a charge.
Suppose I want to assign a different payer to this invoice item. I simply click the checkbox next to the invoice item.
And I click the arrow icon on the Assign Payer button.
I can choose between an account payer and a producer payer. I choose Assign to Account.
This screen lets me select a new payer and invoice stream, if the payer has multiple invoice streams.
I can also decide how to handle invoice items that have been fully or partially paid. No change is needed, so I'll click Cancel to return to the charges screen.
The charges screen has a filter for restricting the charges shown to those owned or paid by the account.
First, I select Only Own & Pay.
Selecting Only Own & Pay shows just the premium charge, because it is paid by the policy owner.
Next, I select Only Owned.
Only Owned shows all charges that are owned by the account, regardless of the payer.
In this case, we see both the premium and the taxes charges.
Let's see what the Only Payer filter does.
Selecting Only Payer filters out the taxes charge because the Miner Fleet Management group is not the payer of the invoice item for the taxes charge.
This concludes our demo on designating an alternate payer.
